content:
{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-07-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Photographs of a typical example of macroscopic haematuria |Description=None |Rubric=Multimedia content |Contributors=Charles Dariane,Bruno Moulin |Order=7}}
'''Figure 3.''' Urine collecting bag reflecting macroscopic haematuria [[File:Figure 3 urine collection bag HUbis.jpg|neant|vignette|'''Figure 3.''' Urine collecting bag reflecting macroscopic haematuria]]

question.title: What is the typical appearance of macroscopic haematuria in a urine collecting bag?
question.description: A photograph of a urine collecting bag showing macroscopic haematuria

option_a.title: A clear or colorless liquid
option_a.description: The appearance of a urine collecting bag without haematuria

option_b.title: A dark or tea-colored liquid
option_b.description: A possible appearance of a urine collecting bag with microscopic haematuria

option_c.title: A blood-red liquid
option_c.description: A possible appearance of a urine collecting bag with gross haematuria

option_d.title: A cloudy or murky liquid
option_d.description: A possible appearance of a urine collecting bag with urinary tract infection

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The letter indicating the correct answer
